activities.loc: Br 3 - Law Enforcement Center - North Courtroom

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Zachary J Hellesen

records.addlTxt:
8:50 AM Defendant Zachary J Hellesen in court.  Attorney William A Demet in court for Zachary J Hellesen.  Attorney Jacob Nelson Garman in court for State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter Donna Moore. 
Matter scheduled as a status conference
Defense indicates they have requested discovery and have received digital discovery in both files but not paper discovery. Has not received an offer from the State. Has filed a bond motion to modify the bond conditions and asks to be heard on that. 
State does not object to modifying the bond to a non violent contact order. 
BTC: Bond conditions modified to no violent contact with C.H.  Matter set over.
Status conference scheduled for November 15, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on November 15, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. No contact with the victim C.H (person, property, residence or family). It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances. This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance.

AMENDED: 9/16/2022: No violent contact with the victim C.H (person, property, residence or family). ALL OTHER CONDITONS REMAIN.

9:18 AM Prosecuting attorney Diane M. Donohoo in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Zachary J Hellesen not in court.  Attorney William A Demet in court for Zachary J Hellesen. Court Reporter Donna Moore. 
Defense was expecting defendant to be present today. Asks that the defendant's appearance is waived.
State does not object. 
BTC: Matter set over for a status.
Status conference scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on September 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.

2:58 PM Prosecuting attorney Jessica E. H. Lynott in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Zachary J Hellesen in court. Attorney William A Demet in court for Zachary J Hellesen. Court Reporter Donna Moore. 
Defense indicates the victim is seeking to lift the no contact condition of the defendant's bond. Makes statements on the record. 
Victim C.H. puts statements on the record. 
State is requesting the defendant's motion to modify the bond conditions is denied and provides arguments as to why. 
BTC: Defendant's motion to modify bond conditions is DENIED.
